acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Not classified from its 96h-LC50 = 320 mg/L for fish (Zebrafish), 48h-EC50 = 560 mg/L for Crustacea (Daphnia magna), 72h-ErC50 = 3500 mg/L for algae (Pseudokirchneriella subcapitata) (AQUIRE, 2010 for any).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >5 g/kg for rabbits (HSDB (2002)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Although a LC50 value of >5.4 mg/L (1,117,648 ppmV) for rats (PATTY (5th, 2001)), classification was not possible since determination of category was impossible. Since the test concentration (5.4 mg/L) was lower than 90% of saturated vapour pressure concentration (23.8537 mg/L), the classification criteria for gas was adopted.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >2000 mg/kg for rats (PATTY (5th, 2001), the substance was classified into "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 5 in GHS classification).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Not classified since it is not non-water soluble (water solubility: 1000000 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2010)) and its acute toxicity is Not classified.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified into Category 3 since flash point 47 degC (closed-cup) (Merck (14th, 2006)) is >=23 degC and <=60 degC. The substance is classified into Class 3, PG III in UNRTDG (UN1192).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 400 degC (Sax (11th, 2004)) exceeding 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on a report of "irritating" for rabbit eye (HSDB (2002)), the substance was classified into Category 2. As relevant information, in EU classification, the substance is classified into Xi; R41.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. Although there is a result of "not irritation after a 48-hour closed-patch application at 8% in petrolatum to human subjects (HSDB (2002)), suitability of the dose selection and the details are not clear.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there is a result of "produced no sensitization reactions" in a maximization test on 25 volunteers (HSDB (2002)), classification was not possible due to the information in a document in List 2.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There is a report that degenerative and regenerative changes in the nasal cavity were noted in animal tests (HSDB (2002)). There is a report that no adverse symptoms were noted in workers exposed to 375 to 1500 ppm for several months (HSDB (2002)). Classification was not possible due to unclear details and lack of other data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on a report that humans find concentrations greater than 200 ppm objectionable because of the strong odor and 400 ppm caused nose and throat irritation (HSDB (2002)) and classification into Xi; R37 in EU classification, the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation).
